items.title: Compilation Challenges with KiTTY
items.body:
Before starting the compilation process, I installed MSYS2 with the WINGW64 shell. Additionally, I installed the following components within it (this might be useful for others):

```
pacman -Syu
pacman -S --needed base-devel mingw-w64-x86_64-toolchain
pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-cmake mingw-w64-x86_64-make mingwg-developer-tools mingw32-base mingw32-gcc-g++ msys-base mingw-w64-x86_64-zlib
pacman -S git
```
To ensure a clean compilation, I selected one of the release versions available [here](https://github.com/cyd01/KiTTY/archive/refs/tags/v0.76.1.13.zip).

After extracting the release, I navigated to the following directory: $KiTTY/0.76b_My_PuTTY/windows. However, upon attempting to compile, I encountered the following disappointment:

```
make -f MAKEFILE.MINGW 9bis
gcc  -Wall -O2 -std=gnu99 -Wvla -D_WINDOWS -DWIN32S_COMPAT -D_NO_OLDNAMES -D__USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO=1 -I.././ -I../charset/ -I../windows/ -I../unix/ -I../crypto/ -I../proxy/ -I../ssh/ -I../terminal/ -I../utils/ -D_WIN32_IE=0x0500 -DWINVER=0x0501 -D_WIN32_WINDOWS=0x0410 -D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0501 -DNO_SECUREZEROMEMORY -DCOVERITY -DNO_HTMLHELP -DFLJ1 -DMOD_WTS -DMOD_PERSO -DMOD_STARTBUTTON -DMOD_SAVEDUMP -DMOD_DISABLEALTGR -DMOD_KEYMAPPING -DMOD_PUTTYX -DMOD_PORTKNOCKING -DMOD_HYPERLINK -DMOD_PRINTCLIP -DMOD_LAUNCHER -DMOD_RECONNECT -DMOD_RUTTY -DMOD_TUTTY -DMOD_ADB -DMOD_BACKGROUNDIMAGE -DMOD_ZMODEM -DMOD_PROXY -DMOD_FAR2L -I.././ -I../../ -I../charset/ -I../windows/ -I../unix/ -I../mac/ -I../macosx -I../../base64 -I../../bcrypt -I../../md5 -I../../regex -I../../url -I../../rutty                 -c ../windows/window.c \
-DBUILD_TIME=`date +'"%d/%m/%Y-%H:%M:%S(%Z)"'` \
-DBUILD_VERSION=`cat version_major.txt` \
-DBUILD_SUBVERSION=`cat version_minor.txt` \
-DMASTER_PASSWORD=`cat ../../masterpassword.txt` \
-DMOD_INTEGRATED_AGENT -DMOD_INTEGRATED_KEYGEN
In file included from .././puttyps.h:10,
                 from .././putty.h:8,
                 from ../windows/window.c:27:
../windows/winstuff.h:115:17: warning: '_stricmp' redeclared without dllimport attribute after being referenced with dll linkage
  115 | #define stricmp _stricmp
      |                 ^~~~~~~~
../windows/../../kitty_commun.h:78:5: note: in expansion of macro 'stricmp'
   78 | int stricmp(const char *s1, const char *s2) ;
      |     ^~~~~~~
../windows/window.c: In function 'RunSessionWithConfSettings':
../windows/window.c:354:13: warning: the address of 'restricted_acl' will always evaluate as 'true' [-Waddress]
  354 |         if (restricted_acl)
      |             ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
In file included from ../windows/window.c:447:
C:/msys64/mingw64/include/wtsapi32.h: At top level:
C:/msys64/mingw64/include/wtsapi32.h:276:16: error: redeclaration of 'enum _WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS'
  276 |   typedef enum _WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS {
      |                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
../windows/window.c:446:14: note: originally defined here
  446 | typedef enum _WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS { WTSVirtualClientData, WTSVirtualFileHandle } WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS;               // WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS is not definned in file wtsapi32.h !!!
      |              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
C:/msys64/mingw64/include/wtsapi32.h:277:5: error: redeclaration of enumerator 'WTSVirtualClientData'
  277 |     WTSVirtualClientData,WTSVirtualFileHandle
      |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
../windows/window.c:446:35: note: previous definition of 'WTSVirtualClientData' with type 'enum _WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS'
  446 | typedef enum _WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS { WTSVirtualClientData, WTSVirtualFileHandle } WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS;               // WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS is not definned in file wtsapi32.h !!!
      |                                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
C:/msys64/mingw64/include/wtsapi32.h:277:26: error: redeclaration of enumerator 'WTSVirtualFileHandle'
  277 |     WTSVirtualClientData,WTSVirtualFileHandle
      |                          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
../windows/window.c:446:57: note: previous definition of 'WTSVirtualFileHandle' with type 'enum _WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS'
  446 | typedef enum _WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS { WTSVirtualClientData, WTSVirtualFileHandle } WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS;               // WTS_VIRTUAL_CLASS is not definned in file wtsapi32.h !!!
      |                                                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
In file included from ../windows/window.c:467:
../../rutty/script_ahk.c: In function 'script_ahk_send':
../../rutty/script_ahk.c:121:64: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  121 |       scriptdata->latest = schedule_timer(scriptdata->timeout, script_timeout, scriptdata);
      |                                                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                                                |
      |                                                                void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script_ahk.c:126:46: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  126 |       schedule_timer(scriptdata->line_delay, script_sendline, scriptdata);
      |                                              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                              |
      |                                              void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
In file included from ../windows/window.c:468:
../../rutty/script.c: In function 'script_sendfile':
../../rutty/script.c:95:64: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
   95 |       scriptdata->latest = schedule_timer(scriptdata->timeout, script_timeout, scriptdata);
      |                                                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                                                |
      |                                                                void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c:100:46: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  100 |       schedule_timer(scriptdata->line_delay, script_sendline, scriptdata);
      |                                              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                              |
      |                                              void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c: In function 'script_sendline':
../../rutty/script.c:261:46: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  261 |       schedule_timer(scriptdata->char_delay, script_sendchar, scriptdata);
      |                                              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                              |
      |                                              void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c:280:64: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  280 |       scriptdata->latest = schedule_timer(scriptdata->timeout, script_timeout, scriptdata);
      |                                                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                                                |
      |                                                                void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c:284:46: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  284 |       schedule_timer(scriptdata->line_delay, script_sendline, scriptdata);
      |                                              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                              |
      |                                              void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c: In function 'script_sendchar':
../../rutty/script.c:313:45: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  313 |      schedule_timer(scriptdata->char_delay, script_sendchar, scriptdata);
      |                                             ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                             |
      |                                             void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c:324:64: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  324 |       scriptdata->latest = schedule_timer(scriptdata->timeout, script_timeout, scriptdata);
      |                                                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                                                |
      |                                                                void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c:328:46: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  328 |       schedule_timer(scriptdata->line_delay, script_sendline, scriptdata);
      |                                              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                              |
      |                                              void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c: In function 'script_setsend':
../../rutty/script.c:468:64: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  468 |       scriptdata->latest = schedule_timer(scriptdata->timeout, script_timeout, scriptdata);
      |                                                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                                                |
      |                                                                void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../../rutty/script.c:473:46: error: passing argument 2 of 'schedule_timer' from incompatible pointer type [-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
  473 |       schedule_timer(scriptdata->line_delay, script_sendline, scriptdata);
      |                                              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                                              |
      |                                              void (*)(void *, long int)
.././putty.h:2643:52: note: expected 'timer_fn_t' {aka 'void (*)(void *, long unsigned int)'} but argument is of type 'void (*)(void *, long int)'
 2643 | unsigned long schedule_timer(int ticks, timer_fn_t fn, void *ctx);
      |                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
../windows/window.c: In function 'WinMain':
../windows/window.c:1107:60: error: implicit declaration of function 'I'; did you mean 'IN'? [-Wimplicit-function-declaration]
 1107 |                         conf_set_int( conf, CONF_protocol, I(PROT_TELNET) ) ;
      |                                                            ^
      |                                                            IN
../windows/window.c:1741:46: warning: cast from pointer to integer of different size [-Wpointer-to-int-cast]
 1741 |         AppendMenu(m, MF_POPUP | MF_ENABLED, (UINT) FontMenu, "Font settings");
      |                                              ^
../windows/window.c: In function 'init_fonts':
../windows/window.c:2679:62: warning: cast from pointer to integer of different size [-Wpointer-to-int-cast]
 2679 |                         char *regStyle = (char*)regularOtm + (int)regularOtm->otmpStyleName;
      |                                                              ^
../windows/window.c:2680:61: warning: cast from pointer to integer of different size [-Wpointer-to-int-cast]
 2680 |                         char *itaStyle = (char*)italicOtm + (int)italicOtm->otmpStyleName;
      |                                                             ^
../windows/window.c: In function 'WndProc':
../windows/window.c:4091:13: warning: this 'if' clause does not guard... [-Wmisleading-indentation]
 4091 |             if (conf_get_bool(conf, CONF_system_colour) !=
      |             ^~
../windows/window.c:4096:17: note: ...this statement, but the latter is misleadingly indented as if it were guarded by the 'if'
 4096 |                 term_reconfig(term, conf);
      |                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
../windows/window.c: In function 'do_text_internal':
../windows/window.c:6590:9: warning: this 'else' clause does not guard... [-Wmisleading-indentation]
 6590 |         else
      |         ^~~~
../windows/window.c:6597:13: note: ...this statement, but the latter is misleadingly indented as if it were guarded by the 'else'
 6597 |             if (bold_font_mode == BOLD_SHADOW && (attr & ATTR_BOLD)) {
      |             ^~
../windows/window.c:6622:9: warning: this 'else' clause does not guard... [-Wmisleading-indentation]
 6622 |         else
      |         ^~~~
../windows/window.c:6628:13: note: ...this statement, but the latter is misleadingly indented as if it were guarded by the 'else'
 6628 |             if (bold_font_mode == BOLD_SHADOW && (attr & ATTR_BOLD)) {
      |             ^~
../windows/window.c:6668:9: warning: this 'else' clause does not guard... [-Wmisleading-indentation]
 6668 |         else
      |         ^~~~
../windows/window.c:6677:13: note: ...this statement, but the latter is misleadingly indented as if it were guarded by the 'else'
 6677 |             if (bold_font_mode == BOLD_SHADOW && (attr & ATTR_BOLD)) {
      |             ^~
make: *** [MAKEFILE.MINGW:1740: window.o] Error 1

```
Could you provide guidance on resolving this issue? Any suggestions or updates to the documentation would also be highly appreciated.

Thank you!
